message.content:
cs.CR, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.SE

Reasoning: 
- cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) is the most likely category as the paper deals with defending against backdoor poisoning attacks on deep learning models.
- cs.LG (Machine Learning) is also likely as the paper proposes a defense mechanism that involves retraining the model on a dataset augmented with the extracted poison signal and corrective relabeling of poisoned samples.
- cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is relevant as the experiments were conducted on the CIFAR10 dataset, which is a popular computer vision dataset.
- cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is relevant as the paper deals with deep learning models and their vulnerabilities to backdoor attacks.
- cs.SE (Software Engineering) is less likely but still possible as the paper proposes a defense mechanism that involves filtering out poisoned samples from clean samples with proven guarantees.
